title: descending whole step and half step

content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a half note and two quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C5, B-flat 4, and A4.
The figure presents a half note and two quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C5, B4, and A4.
The figure presents a half note and two quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C5, B4, and A-flat 4.
The figure presents a half note and two quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C5, B-flat 4, and A-flat 4.

content.answer: The figure presents a half note and two quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C5, B-flat 4, and A4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
